title: dreissen
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]AMX-009 Dreissen[/b]

A high speed, heavy [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. Using data from the older [[Rick Dom II]] and inspired by the legendary [[Dom (mobile suit)|]] series, it performed very well using its sleeve cannons. It was [[Rakan Dahkaran]]'s first mecha of choice during Gundam ZZ.

[[gundam_unicorn|During the units' tenure with the Sleeves]], many issues with the design (namely the exposed [[arm cannon]] power cables) were ironed out and they were issued heat sabers to aid in close quarters combat.

title: juusenki_l-gaim
body:
[b][i]Heavy Metal L-Gaim[/i][/b] (重戦機（ヘビーメタル）エルガイム, [i]Jūsenki (Hebī Metaru) Erugaimu[/i], literally "Heavy Military Strategy L-Gaim") is an 80s [[science fiction]] space opera [[mecha]] anime television series which aired in [[Japan]] from 1984 to 1985. It was produced by [[sunrise_(company)|Sunrise]] and was directed by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]]. L-Gaim is heavily influenced by previous sci-fi movies of the time, mostly [[Star Wars]].

Its characters and mecha were designed by [[Nagano Mamoru]], who would later go on to make designs for [[Zeta Gundam]] and create The [[Five Star Stories]] series.

title: serbu_super-shorty
body:
The [b]Super-Shorty[/b] is a compact shotgun manufactured in the US by Serbu Firearms. It is essentially a conventional pump-action shotgun with no shoulder stock and an extremely short (usually 6½ inches) barrel, hence the name. Since the tubular magazine of such a shotgun can be no longer than the barrel, this modification also sharply limits the weapon's magazine capacity to only two rounds (as opposed to the five to seven typical of full-length pump-action shotguns).

As a smoothbore handgun, the Super-Shorty is classified as "Any Other Weapon" under the US National Firearms Act of 1934, meaning civilian transfers of ownership in the United States require the purchase of a $5 federal tax stamp and registration with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives.

wikipedia: "Serbu Super-Shorty":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbu_Super-Shorty]

title: netherrack_(minecraft)
body:
Soft, [[rock]]y [[block (minecraft)|substance]] that makes up vast majority of [[The Nether (minecraft)|The Nether's]] terrain in [i][[Minecraft]].[/i] Dark red in color with slight purplish tinge, and its texture feels somehow fleshy. Fire on top of it will burn indefinitely and warped or crimson [[fungi]] [[mycelium]] can grow on it. 

Netherrack can be smelted into nether [[brick]].

title: indirect_kiss
body:
A trope where a character who likes someone else shares food or a drink with them and calls it an "indirect kiss."

In older and grittier works, an indirect kiss can be seen in the form of sharing a [[cigarette]]; in some cases this would be if one person lit a cigarette with the other's cigarette.

h4. See also

* [[kiss]]

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Indirect Kiss":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IndirectKiss

title: ammunition_belt
body:
A belt of [[ammunition]] as feeding device for belt-fed [[gun|firearms]]. Commonly [[machine gun]], [[minigun]] or [[Gatling gun]].

The [[rifle cartridge|cartridges]] are held in chains of looped metal links which can be connected to form belts of any length. It may disintegrate after firing or not. These disposable links are discarded (along with the empty [[shell casing]]s) upon firing. 

Not to be confused with a [[bandolier]], which is a belt or sash containing cartridges worn on a person's chest, or an [[ammunition pouch]], which is a [[pouch]] for holding ammunition that may be worn around the waist.

title: stay_gold_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese Racehorse. Sired by [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Golden Sash (herself sired by Dictus, a very temperamental but successful French racehorse), he was blessed with speed and sheer durability but cursed(?) by the compounded temperament of his parents.

He is best known as the sire of [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]] (A temperamental racehorse who won the 2011 Japanese Triple Crown), [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] (An unpredictable racehorse who was almost as successful as Orfevre), and [[Oju Chosan (racehorse)|]] (an astounding [b]6[/b] time winner of the Nakayama Grand Jump, as well as the 3 time winner of the Nakayama Daishogai).

In spite of the success of his offspring, the two above who ended up as the luminaries of their era, Stay Gold himself only won a single GI race in his 50 race-long career (his final race at the 2001 Hong Kong Vase) and tended to collect second places. To be fair, some of this has to do with the fact that he had to contend with the luminaries of [i]his[/i] era ([[Special Week (racehorse)|]] and [[T.M. Opera O (racehorse)|]] among others).

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], aside from [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] being a popular character and [[Orfevre (umamusume)|]] being implemented much later, he is also the real-life sire of [[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]] and [[Dream Journey (umamusume)|]]. In fact his Umamusume counterpart finally had a mention in Dream Journey's scenario. Otherwise, a stand-in of him appears in the first season of the anime (see [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)|]]).

h4. See also
* [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)]] - a background character from the [[Umamusume (anime)|Umamusume anime]] presumed to be based on Stay Gold

title: k.a.r.r.
body:
[b]K.A.R.R.[/b] is the short name of a fictional sentient robot character from the American adventure and science fiction TV series [[Knight Rider]] released in the 80s.

An acronym for [b]Knight Automated Roving Robot[/b]. Like [[K.I.T.T]], KARR is an artificially intelligent electronic computer module in the body of a highly advanced, very mobile, robotic automobile: a 1982 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am sports "car":[/wiki_pages/car].
Unlike KITT, whose primary directive is to protect human life, KARR was programmed for self-preservation, making him a ruthless and unpredictable threat. KARR was featured in two episodes of the original 1982 series.

KARR was voiced by "Peter Cullen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Cullen] in Season 1 episode [i]Trust Doesn't Rust[/i], and in Season 3 episode [i]K.I.T.T vs K.A.R.R[/i], he was voiced by "Paul Frees":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Frees]. In the Knight Rider 2008 series, he was once again voiced by Peter Cullen.

title: barok_van_zieks
body:
The main prosecutor in [[The Great Ace Attorney]] games.

Barok has [[short hair|short]], somewhat messy [[purple hair]], [[blue eyes|blue]]-[[grey eyes]], and a [[scar on face|scar on his face]]. He wears a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black jacket|black justacorp]] outlined with gold stripes and gold [[buttons]]. He wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] underneath, gold [[epaulettes]], a [[white sash]] with a red stripe, [[grey pants]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], a [[white ascot]] pinned on with a gold [[crest]], [[white gloves]], and Klint's prosecutor's [[badge]]. Occasionally, he wears a [[black cape]] he takes off when he gets serious. He carries a [[sword]] with him at all times worn on his right side, suggesting he's left handed.

title: russo-japanese_war
body:
The Russo–Japanese War (1904–05) was fought between the Russian Empire and the Empire of Japan over territorial ambitions in Manchuria and Korea. Russia suffered a series of defeats, and lost a large portion of their navy at the Battle of Tsushima. The war ended in a peace treaty brokered by [[Theodore Roosevelt]], which many in Japan felt did not contain favorable enough terms considering their military superiority. The war marked the emergence of Japan as a major world power, and one of the catalyst of the Russian revolution and subsequent civil war in 1917.

h4. See Also

title: chinese_civil_war
body:
A civil war within [[China]] from 1921 to 1949. The war began after the collapse of the first Republic of China which saw the country being divided between various rival warlords who fought to unite the country. In 1927, the [[Kuomintang]] (KMT)-led Republic of China under the leadership of [[Chiang Kai-shek]] managed to unite a large part of the country, however, conflict between the then allied Chinese Communist Party (CCP) resulted in a crackdown that forced the CCP on "The Long March" to the northern parts of the country between 1934 - 1935. The outbreak of the [[Second Sino-Japanese war]] in 1937 forced the KMT and CCP to work together to defend the country.

After [[Japan]] was defeated in [[World War II]] in 1945, fighting between both parties resumed. While the KMT had a manpower and weaponry advantage, it was plagued with corruption and economical problems. Meanwhile, the smaller CCP forces led by [[Mao Zedong]] used a combination of disciplined guerilla fighters, hit-and-run tactics, and various propaganda methods to recruit more members. After several key warlords and troops defected to the CCP, the KMT lost the control of the mainland China in 1949 and retreated to the island of [[Taiwan]] while the CCP established the People's Republic of China (PRC) over it.

As there is no official armistice, the civil war is still considered ongoing, with tensions between mainland China and Taiwan and its complex political status remains an issue.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_Civil_War]

title: american_revolution
body:
A military conflict between the [[United Kingdom|British Empire]] and the 13 American colonies that took place from 1776 to 1783 and ended with the Treaty of Paris, in which the British Empire formally acknowledged the independence and sovereignty of the colonies. Following the war the colonies formed their own country, the [[united states|United States of America]].

h4. See Also

* [[tag_group:history]]
other_names: アメリカ合衆国の独立

body:
A professional [[basketball]] team based in [[Boston]], Massachusetts. They are a member of the Eastern Conference of the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA) and were founded in 1946. The Celtics have won 18 NBA championships, the most in the NBA, and are one of the most successful and historic franchises in the league.

The Boston Celtics' traditional uniform colors are green and white. The team's primary home uniform is white with green lettering, while the primary road uniform is green with white lettering. The team also has alternate uniforms with different color combinations, such as a black uniform with green and white trim.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Boston Celtics":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston_Celtics]
* "Wikipedia: National Basketball Association (NBA)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Basketball_Association]
other_names: ボストン・セルティックス

title: osaka_shizuku_(odaiba_beach_girl)

The costume is a light [[blue bikini]]; a [[frilled bikini|frill trimed]] top fitted with a short sheer veil under the waist and a striped ribbon, and bottoms with a microskirt-like frill and two blue striped bows on the side. She wears a pearl [[armlet]] on the left arm and blue striped arm cuff. She wears [[white footwear|white]] [[sandals]] as her footwear. She's often seen carrying a [[transparent umbrella]].

title: pompadour
body:
A hair style in which the front hair is swept up from the forehead into a high roll at the top of the head. Often exaggerated in animation to comical proportions. Popular with rockers, gang members, and other rebels.

The Japanese often misunderstand the pompadour as the "リーゼント (regent style)."

h4. Characters/people with this hair style

title: escudo_sword_(rayearth)
body:
The swords that the three Magic Knights use in [[Magic Knight Rayearth]]. It is made from the legendary ore Escudo, and can only be forged by [[Presea (rayearth)|]]. The Escudo swords will evolve and become stronger, but only if their users’ wills likewise become stronger after enduring various tribulations. Each sword can only ever be used by its intended owner, with negative consequences if anyone else, even a fellow Magic Knight, tries to wield it.

The type of sword each girl wields is different:

* [[Shidou Hikaru]]’s sword is a traditional broadsword with an intricate red hilt. It turns into flames if someone else touches it.
* [[Ryuuzaki Umi]]’s sword is a rapier with a blue hilt resembling dragon wings. It dissolves into water if someone else touches it.
* [[Hououji Fuu]]’s sword is a large claymore with a circular green hilt. It becomes unusually heavy if someone else touches it.

title: left_4_dead_seizonshatachi
body:
[i]Left 4 Dead Seizonshatachi[/i] (LEFT 4 DEAD ―生存者たち―) also known as [i]Left 4 Dead: Survivors[/i] was a Japanese arcade game version of [i]Left 4 Dead 2[/i]. It was released on December 10, 2014 before the servers went offline on July 26, 2017.

The game features the same campaign mode from the original [i][[Left 4 Dead 1|Left 4 Dead]][/i] and [i][[Left 4 Dead 2]][/i] but with 4 new exclusive survivors, replacing the original 8.

title: kyouki_sanmyaku_~jashin_no_itadaki~
body:
An original scenario created for the [[Call of Cthulhu]] TRPG format by [[Madaraushi]], titled [i]Mountains of Madness: Summit of Deities[/i] in English. The setting is based on H.P. Lovecraft's story, [[At The Mountains of Madness]], and concerns a climbing expedition up the tallest (fictional) mountain in the world. In addition to the players' own created characters, they are joined by three NPCs: [[Kevin Kingston]] (also known as K2), [[Hotaka Azusa]], and [[Kosy Uszko]].

In October 2021, a crowdfunding campaign was launched on Campfire in order to secure funding for an animated adaptation of the scenario. The project surpassed its goal by 1491%, confirming the production of Kyouki Sanmyaku: Naked Peak.

title: makoto_(street_fighter)
body:
[b]Makoto[/b] ([i][b]まこと[/b][/i]) is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. She first appeared in [[street_fighter_iii_(series)|Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike]] and is voiced by Makoto Tsumura. She is a playable character in the game [[street_fighter_iv_(series)|Super Street Fighter IV]].

Makoto is a young Japanese girl, trained in Rindoukan karate. Her karate style is very similar to that of Shotokan karate. Although having little fashion sense for a girl her age, she still hates it when she is mistaken for a boy. She develops something of a rivalry with kunoichi [[Ibuki (street fighter)|Ibuki]], as shown by their alternate opening when they fight each other.

Since her father's death, Makoto's dojo has been floundering and her older brother decided to become a businessman, leaving Makoto to elevate her dojo back to its former glory. Horrified to discover the decrepit state the dojo is in, she first enters S.I.N.'s tournament in Super Street Fighter IV in order to win money to renovate it. During the tournament, she encounters and fights [[Fei Long]] in the hopes that the publicity will enhance Rindo-kan's reputation. Apparently she is the overall tournament winner - as her win quote against [[seth (street fighter)|Seth]] is the only one that says the character has become the tournament champ, and in her ending she says that she "beats the pants off" of all her opponents - however she didn't win any money since the tournament sponsor, Seth, was killed and S.I.N. disbanded. She decides to rebuild her fathers dojo by hand, and make money the old-fashioned way.

Ultimately, she finds [[ryu (street fighter)|Ryu]] in 3rd Strike and challenges him to enhance her dojo's reputation. After her fight with Ryu, the publicity attracts a swarm of potential students to her dojo. Unfortunately, she enforces the rather counterproductive policy of rejecting aspiring students who are unable to defeat her first, and thus far none have.
other_names: まこと(ストリートファイター)

body:
A type of large [[sword]] with an undulating, wavy blade that resembles stylized fire. While many flamberge are two-handed [[greatsword|greatswords]] like the [[zweihander]], the term flamberge refers to the type of blade and can be found on other swords like [[rapier|rapiers]].

body: An automobile which has been produced by [[Toyota]] in Japan since 1955. It is primarily a line of mid-size luxury cars that is marketed as an upmarket offering in the Toyota lineup.

title: ebenholz_(ironlily)
body:
One of [[Ironlily]]'s recurring characters. A girl with [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]] who wears a [[reverse bikini armor]] version of Swiss-style [[plate armor]] and wields a [[polearm|poleaxe]]. Her helmet has the text "Unus pro omnibus, omnes pro uno" ("One for all, all for one"; Swizerland's national motto) along the rim. Has a few [[battle_scarred|battle scars]] on unprotected parts of her body.
Friends with [[Perlweiss (ironlily)|]].
Was known as [b]Swiss-chan[/b] at first; the name [b]Ebenholz[/b] was first given in post #6832174.

title: spathodea_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Spathodea[/b] is a playable character from [[Reverse:1999]]. A short, fourteen years old girl from Melbourne, [[Australia]], she is the daughter of immigrants who came to Australia eighteen years ago. An energetic girl who loves boxing, her encounter with [[Vertin (reverse:1999)|Vertin]] leads her to discover she is the reincarnation of the first Priestess of the Uluru Games. She is the main female protagonist of the "Revival! The Uluru Games." sidestory.

She is voiced by Makeda Bromfield in English and [[Aoki Shiki]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance
* !post #6908277: Default
* !post #6908316: Insight II: Sparrow, Hummingbird, Flower
* !post #7766831: Onwards, To Victory!

He has [[light brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]], and wears a red and white [[striped shirt]], [[brown pants]] with [[suspenders]], and no shoes. After forming Eversea, he puts on a new outfit consisting of a [[red vest]], [[brown pants]] and a black sash around his waist.

She has [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her Cogsmeade outfit consists of a [[white shirt]], [[brown pants]] with [[suspenders]], brown [[boots]], [[brown gloves]], and a pair of green-tinted [[goggles]].

She shares a similar appearance to the False from [[Hermitcraft]] who crosses over into Empires through the rift, though they can usually be distinguished by their clothes, as Hermit False wears her casual outfit.

title: faye_valentine
body:
Faye Valentine is a female bounty hunter from the series [[Cowboy Bebop]]. The buxom, dark-haired former gambler is perhaps the most dishonest out of all the crew. Faye has amnesia, her memories of the time before the Gate disaster all but gone.

Faye's signature weapon is a [[Glock]] 30, although she is seen to use a [[Heckler & Koch]] [[h&k mp5k|MP5K]].  She pilots a zipcraft named [[Red Tail (cowboy bebop)|]], based heavily on the "pod" design many of the ships in Cowboy Bebop use.

Her standard outfit consists of [[yellow shorts]], a matching buttoned shirt, white ankle boots, flesh-colored stockings, and a loose [[red jacket]].

Voiced by [[Hayashibara Megumi]].

title: kate_(idolmaster)
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Kate is a Briton whose visit to Japan led to becoming an idol. While her hometown is listed as England, it’s made clear that she is specifically from London. She enjoys British pubs. Her notable physical features tend to be her large eyebrows and numerous freckles.
She seems to not know much about Japan culture or laws, as she is quick to believe minors can drive when she mistakes [[Kusakabe Wakaba]] for a child. 

* Age: 20
* Height: 157 cm
* Weight: 45 kg
* Birthday: August 15
* Blood type: O
* Three sizes: 83-59-85
* Hobbies: Looking at Japanese magazines
* Writing Hand: Right
* Horoscope: Leo
* Hometown: England

title: bellflower
body:
The bellflowers belong to the [i]Campanulaceae[/i] family of plants, which comprises around 2,000 species. Inflorescences vary widely. These hardy perennials bloom from early summer to early fall. The leaves are simple and alternating, while the flowers are bell-shaped and consist of a narrow lobed corolla.

Not to be confused with [[lily of the valley]], which has a shorter, rounder bell-shaped flower.

h4. See also
* [[Belladonna (plant)|]]
* [[Chinese bellflower]]
* [[Gentiana (flower)|]]
* [[Lily of the valley]]
* [[Sandersonia (flower)|]]
* [[Snowbell (flower)|]]
* [[Tag group:Flowers]]

title: kinomoto_sakura_(magic_dream_costume)
body:
One of [[Kinomoto Sakura]]'s costumes that [[Daidouji Tomoyo]] made for her, and easily the most recognizable and popular one. Sakura wears it in the anime's first opening song [i]Catch You Catch Me[/i], though she's never actually depicted capturing Clow Cards while wearing it despite how well-known it is. Due to this costume's popularity, it can also be attributed to [[parody|parodies]] where other characters are wearing an adapted variant of it.

It is a [[pink dress]] over a [[white shirt|white blouse]] with [[puffy sleeves]] and a [[red bow]], a [[pink hat|pink]] [[mob cap]] with a [[pink bow]], [[white wings]], [[white gloves]] with a red bow, [[white thighhighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[mary janes]].

title: ulysses_31
body:
[b][i]Ulysses 31[/i][/b] (宇宙伝説ユリシーズ31 [i]Uchū Densetsu Yurishīzu Sātīwan[/i] or [i]Space Legend Ulysses 31[/i]) (French: [i]Ulysse 31[/i]) is a Franco-Japanese animated [[science fiction]] television series from 1981 that updates the [[Greek mythology]] of Odysseus (known as "Ulysses" in Latin, hence the name) to the 31st century. 

Ulysses 31 comprised 26 half hour episodes and was produced by DIC Audiovisuel in conjunction with anime studio Tokyo Movie Shinsha. This is also the first show produced by DiC Entertainment, now Cookie Jar Entertainment.

The plot line of the series, (made by the French Jean Chalopin), describes the struggles of Ulysses and his crew who travel across space and face the divine entities that rule the universe, the ancient gods from Greek mythology.

[[Kawamori Shouji]] and [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] from Studio Nue (famous for their work in [[Macross]]) made several [[spacecraft]] and [[mecha]] designs for the show. The entire series is available in English in a complete DVD box set in the UK released by Contender Entertainment, and in Australia by Madman Entertainment. In the United States, one DVD entitled [i]Ulysses 31: The Mysteries of Time[/i] was released, containing only four selected episodes.

The first four episodes are available on Jaroo, an online video site operated by Cookie Jar Entertainment, whom DIC has since merged with. There are currently no plans to add more episodes.

h4. See also

* [[Odysseus (spacecraft)|]]
* [[ulysses_(ulysses_31)|Ulysses]]
* [[telemachus_(ulysses_31)|Telemachus]]
* [[yumi_(ulysses_31)|Yumi]]
* [[nono_(ulysses_31)|Nono]]

title: taiyou_no_kiba_dougram
body:
太陽の牙ダグラム ([i]Taiyou no Kiba [[Dougram]][/i], [b]Fang of the Sun Dougram[/b]) is a 75-episode [[mecha]] anime TV series  created by Takahashi Ryosuke and produced by [[sunrise_(company)|Sunrise]] in the early 80s.

It aired in Japan from October 23, 1981 to March 25, 1983 on TV Tokyo. 

A 1983 full-length feature film, [b]Dougram: Documentary of the Fang of the Sun[/b], summarized the TV series.

A manga based on the series titled [[Get Truth: Taiyou no Kiba Dougram]] began publication in 2021. The manga is illustrated by [[Ohtagaki Yasuo]].

Many designs from the series were licensed for use in [[Battletech]]'s original release, though they were later replaced by original designs.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fang_of_the_Sun_Dougram]

title: pen_(medium)
body:
Art created with a [[pen]], which deposits [[ink (medium)|ink]] onto a surface, typically paper. Resulting lines are thin, with sharp edges. Most pens make lines of constant width, with multiple pens being used to create different line widths. [[nib pen (medium)|Nib pens]], however, can create lines with varying thickness for added expression. Pens can be paired with [[marker (medium)|markers]], [[calligraphy brush_(medium)|brushes]], [[graphite (medium)|graphite]], [[colored pencil (medium)]], or [[watercolor (medium)|watercolors]] to create filled portions in an work, with the pen often being used as [[lineart]].

h4. Links

* "Wikipedia entry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pen

title: alonso_quixano
body:
Main protagonist of [[Don Quixote (novel)|]].

[b]Alonso Quijano[/b], also known as [b]Alonso Quixano[/b], [b]Don Quijote[/b] or [b]Don Quixote[/b], is an hidalgo (member of the lowest nobility) from the [[spain|Spanish]] reign of La Mancha who reads so many chivalric romances that he [[crazy|loses his mind]] and decides to become a [[knight]]-errant ([i]caballero andante[/i]) to revive [[chivalry]] and serve his nation and his kingdom.

He is a very tall and skinny middle age [[beard]]ed man who wears a rusty [[armor]] and wields a twisted [[sword]]. He is often depicted wearing a [[basin|shaving basin]] as a makeshift helmet.

h6. Derivative characters

title: grappler_baki
body:
A [[martial arts]] action manga and anime series written by [[Itagaki Keisuke]], first serialized in Weekly Shounen Champion in 1991, later spawned several spin-off medias. Best known for its raw, ultraviolent theme and use of exaggerated [[muscular male|muscle]]s and facial expressions.

h4. Plot
Born to a wealthy mother [[Akezawa Emi]], [[Hanma Baki]] is one of many offspring of [[Hanma Yujiro]], who inseminated women around the world in an attempt to create his "perfect successor". Having endured Yujiro's harsh training to become the "strongest creature on Earth", Baki was soundly defeated by his father in a "graduation" fight, which resulted in his mother Emi being killed by Yujiro for her "weak genes".

Baki's initial admiration of Yujiro turns into hatred and he swore to surpass his monstrous father to avenge his mother. Baki later enters an underground fighting tournament with no rules, facing many of the strongest fighters of various styles, in which Baki seeks to use this brutal combat to hone his prowess in hope of defeating Yujiro one day.

h4. See also
* [[Baki one-hand push-up (meme)]]
* [[Demon back (baki)|]]
* [[Doppo is pissed!! (meme)|]]
* [[Itagaki Keisuke (style)]]
* [[Retsu Kaioh's cartwheel punch (meme)]]
* [[Retsu Kaioh's head lying in a hospital bed (meme)]]
* [[Triceratops fist]]

title: baki_one-hand_push-up_(meme)

title: catfishing
body: When a person fakes their identity online to a person who is potentially romantically interested in them. This can involve the catfish using misleading or edited photos to make themselves look significantly more attractive than they would in reality, or pretending to be someone else by using another person's photos.

title: leucochloridium_paradoxum
body:
[[Parasite|Parasitic]] maggot that uses snails as an intermediate host. Notable because its infestation is marked by the host snail turning bright green with extremely swollen eye-stalks covered in bands of bright colors, a change meant to lure predators for it to pass onto in the next part of its life cycle. 

h4.See also 
* [[parasite]] 
* [[snail]] 
* [[snail girl]] 
* [[List of Animals]]
other_names: ロイコクロリディウム
レウコクロリディウム

title: hermanubis_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[Genshin Impact]] character.

Hermanubis was a priest in the Great Red Sand, Sumeru, during King Deshret's reign. He was known as the "greatest of sages" due to his wisdom.

Hermanubis' power [spoiler]continues to exist to this day, with [[Cyno (genshin impact)|]] as someone who suffered as a result of his power.[/spoiler]

title: xiao_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character. Character designed by "D and SS (碎碎)":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Xiao/Design]

[i]One of the mighty and illuminated adepti guarding Liyue, also heralded as the "Vigilant Yaksha." Despite his youthful appearance, tales of his exploits have been documented for millennia. He is especially fond of Wangshu Inn's Almond Tofu. This is because it tastes just like the sweet dreams he used to devour.[/i]

title: liga_mx
body:
The Liga MX, officially known as the Liga BBVA MX for sponsorship reasons, is the top professional football division in [[Mexico]]. Formerly known as the Primera División de México (Mexican First Division), it is contested by 18 clubs and is divided into two tournaments – "Apertura" and "Clausura"– which typically run from July to December (the former) and January to May (the latter). The champion of each tournament is decided via a playoff ("Liguilla") system.
h4. Clubs

title: whiplash_(2014_movie)
body:
Whiplash is a 2014 psychological drama film directed by Damien Chazelle. The film follows [[Andrew Neiman]], played by Miles Teller, an ambitious music student and aspiring jazz drummer who is pushed to his limits by [[Terence Fletcher]], played by J.K. Simmons, an abusive music conductor and perfectionist for the fictional Shaffer Conservatory in [[New York City]]. The film explores concepts of perfectionism, dedication, and success and deconstructs the concept of ambition.

The film won several awards including Best Supporting Actor for J.K. Simmons during the 87th Academy Awards.

title: beverage_dispenser
body:
An apparatus that dispenses flavored [[drink|beverages]] other than water.
It consists of a vessel connected with a faucet. Most designs are meant to be placed on table, and sometimes they have an [[ice]] chamber inside.

title: ia_(vocaloid)
body:
IA is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by 1st Place Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine. She gained an English vocal in 2018 with the [[CeVIO]] engine.

Developed for the "-ARIA ON THE PLANETES-," project, her voice provider is the famous singer, Lia. She was illustrated by [[Akasaka Aka]].  She has very long, light blonde hair, blue eyes, and hair ornaments. She wears a loose black top- over a [[tank top]], pink [[pleated skirt]], and white [[boots]]. Her legwear is [[uneven legwear|asymmetrical]] and she has a [[thigh strap]].

h4. Official art

* !post #7760706: [[IA (rocks) (vocaloid)|IA Rocks]]

h4. See also

* [[IA (Rocks)_(Vocaloid)|]]
* [[one (cevio)|ONE]] (the second vocal in the "- ARIA ON THE PLANETES -" project)

h4. External links

* "Official site":http://1stplace.co.jp/ia/

title: ass-to-ass_penetration
body:
A [[sex]] position where the participants are facing their [[ass]]es toward each other while inserting, mimicking a post-coital position that an animal in the canid family (i.e. a [[dog]]) would take.

Most commonly seen in [[bestiality]] works.

title: sexual_exercising
body:
Any form of [[exercising]] where the participant is also engaging in some form of sexual activity, either alone or with another. Such as having [[sex]] while [[weightlifting]] or [[running]], engaging in [[oral]] while doing [[push-ups]], or [[masturbation]] while [[running]].

h4. See also

* [[zenra]]

title: beni-enma
body:
Saber-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the sparrow from the Japanese fable [i]Shita-kiri Suzume[/i] ("Tongue-Cut Sparrow"). Her Noble Phantasm is "Jyuu-Ou Hanketsu - Tsuzura no Michiyuki".

When not in battle, she is the proprietress of the Enma Pavilion, and runs a culinary course for Heroic Spirits -- her strict nature and acerbic tongue towards her students has given her the fan nickname "loli birb [[Gordon Ramsay]]".

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Harada Takehito]]
[b]Voice Actress[/b]: [[Kuno Misaki]]

h4.Variants

* [[Beni-enma Alter]]

body: [[Beni-enma]] in her Third Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Her hair and eyes become brighter red than before, and her sparrow-themed hat is a little larger as well. Her kimono is embellished with colorful fathers ranging from aqua, to blue, to red at the tips, she has a green bow around her waist, and she wears knee-length white socks beneath a set of leg armor and platform sandals.

title: anal_prolapse
body:
A [[anal prolapse]] occurs when the rectal walls have prolapsed to a degree where they protrude out the [[anus]] and are visible outside the body.

h4. Related Terms

title: vaginal_prolapse
body:
A uterine prolapse occurs when the [[uterus]] sags or slips ([[cervix]] ahead) from its normal position and into the [[pussy|vagina]]. In severe cases, the uterus can slip outside the vagina to a certain degree.

h4. Related Terms
* [[anal prolapse]]
* [[prolapse]]

title: more_deban
body:
Phrase from post #1311777, which appeared as the [[Sword Art Online]]'s novel volume 10 [[back cover]] art: [[Lisbeth (sao)|]] holding a [[placard]] with the phrase "MORE" and [[Silica]] holding the sign with "[i]DEBAN[/i]" (出番, literally means "one's turn," i.e. screentime or airtime).

Silica and Lisbeth make sporadic appearances in the story proper both in the novels and in the anime despite being very popular characters due to their relegation to supporting roles after their lead roles in their respective story arcs ended. [[Leafa (sao)|]] and [[Sinon]] later suffer the same and "join the duo in back cover art five volumes later":[https://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2014/08/13/sword-art-online-more-deban-club-grows-spoiler-warning].

title: photo_bashing
body:
When photos are manipulated together to form a scene. A popular technique for scenery artists especially, to speed up the workflow of tedious detail. Usually, photos are manipulated in a manner to make the multiple images blend together seamlessly.

Add the [[mixed media]] tag if combined with any other medium, such as 2D or 3D characters.

Do not use this tag if there's no substantial photo manipulation. If the image background is a single photo, use [[photo background]] instead.

Do not use this tag if [[3d background]] is applicable instead. There has to 100% be elements of manipulated photos.

Later introduced in 2.3's "Origami Bird Clash" event, in which she was depicted as a slightly more purple bird lacking a halo, with a regular triple ahoge that most Origami Birds sport, a constellation pattern in place of a necklace, and her rhinestones.

title: miracle_nikki
body:
The 3rd game of the [[Nikki (series)]] series, a Chinese mobile dress-up game series developed by Paper Studio. English server published by Elex, localized as Love Nikki: Dress-up Queen.

It uses very detailed and varied clothing, which artists sometimes use to create their on characters which they then draw.

It features gacha, crafting and drop mechanics, similar to personification games, as well as an actual storyline.

title: kikuo
body:
An umbrella tag for media related to [[Kikuo (artist)|]]. Which could be referring to his art, music, or characters.

A freelance music producer from Kanagawa, Japan. He is a composer, arranger, lyricist,  engineer, and illustrator. He creates his music using [[Vocaloid]]. He is also notable for achieving the highest number of views of a Vocaloid song on [[Spotify]], and completing the first world tour in the history of Vocaloid producers.

His art is commonly confused with the art of [[Si-ku]]. Who is the artist who makes the art for various album covers and some of his music videos.

title: daba_myroad
body:
The protagonist of [[Juusenki L-Gaim]]. Daba is a young man who was entrusted by his grandfather with the custom-built Heavy Metal named [[L-Gaim]] [[mecha]], and would later [[pilot]] it as he and his friends are constantly thrown into hairy situations. 

Physically very fit and strong (despite his common man appearance), he is also well trained in combat. Daba is very friendly and somewhat of a womanizer, as he managed to passively bring [[Fanneria Amu]] and [[Gaw Ha Leecee]] to his side without any overt persuasion.

In [[real life]] his original character design was based on [[Luke Skywalker]] ([[Mark Hamill]]) from [[Star Wars]].

title: lina_inverse
body:
The notoriously hot-tempered, bandit-killing, fireball-throwing "Dragon Spooker" who appears in every incarnation of the [[Slayers]] franchise. Lina is a traveling sorceress who has mastered black magic and is known for utilizing the highly destructive spell Dragon Slave at inappropriate times. Despite her foul temper and extreme power, Lina also possesses a cool mind which helps her get out of nearly impossible situations.

The [[lina (dota)|Lina Inverse]] seen in [[dota 2|Defense of the Ancients 2]] is a direct [[name connection]] and likeness to this character.
Voiced by [[Hayashibara Megumi]]

title: distress_hand_signal
body:
Encompasses various hand signals to indicate stress and need of rescue.


* "Violence at home signal for help":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Signal_for_Help]
A single-handed gesture that can be used by an individual to alert others that they feel threatened and need help.
It is performed by holding one hand up with the thumb tucked into the palm, then folding the four other fingers down.

* "Maritime and aviation help signal":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Distress_hand_signal#Maritime_and_aviation]
Arms stretched upwards to form a "Y" sign for "Yes" to signal the need of rescue to an emergency helicopter.

h4. See also

* [[Sign language]]

title: shinku
body:
[i]Pure Ruby[/i] or [i]Reiner Rubin[/i]

Fifth [[Rozen Maiden]] Doll. A prissy, demanding doll who acts like a Victorian aristocrat. She uses rose [[petals]] in battles and a [[cane]]. She enjoys drinking [[tea]] from her special [[teacup]] and watching [[Kunkun]]. Her master is [[Sakurada Jun]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]] with [[drill sidelocks]]. Her [[lolita fashion|outfit]] consists of a [[red bonnet|red]] [[bonnet]], a [[long dress|long ]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[red dress]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[frilled sleeves]], a [[frilled capelet|frilled]] [[red capelet]] held with a [[green bowtie]] and a [[pink rose]] [[flower brooch|brooch]], [[white bloomers]] and [[white pantyhose|pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]] with a [[footwear flower]].

title: tachie_(fate)
body:
A heroine of [[Fate/stay night]] introduced in Fate/unpublished material and Shielder-class Servant of Ernest Gravehill.

Known as the Stray Servant (はぐれ サーヴァント), she was a heroine candidate during the development of [[Fate/stay night]] who was left unused in the final version. She was considered along with [[medusa_(fate)|Rider]] and [[medea_(fate)|Caster]] to be a possible heroine, but she was cut due to the plot beginning to stray so as to keep it manageable for the player. As [[artoria_pendragon_(fate)|Saber]] is a "Servant of the Sword", she was to be her rival as a Shielder, "Servant of the Shield."

The design was later revived for [[Fate/Grand Order]] in 2015 for Kinoko Nasu to allow her to be one of the main heroines along with [[artoria_pendragon_(fate)|Saber]] and [[jeanne_d'arc_(fate)|Ruler]], thus becoming [[Mash Kyrielight]].

title: lorem_ipsum
body:
A standard passage of filler text used by designers and typesetters to visualize how text will look on a page before the finished text is available. Also used as placeholder text to fill up empty space in general.

The text itself is derived from a real [[Latin text]] about pain and exertion written by [[Marcus Tullius Cicero]] in 45 BC, but it's so heavily cut-out and corrupted that it's little more than gibberish.

h4. External links
* "LIpsum.com":[https://www.lipsum.com/]
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lorem_ipsum]

title: cloud_retainer_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character in [[Genshin Impact]].

One of the adepti residing in Liyue, taking the form of a [[crane (animal)|]] with primarily white and blue plumage. She seems to have raised [[Ganyu (Genshin Impact)|Ganyu]] after the latter's parents died and is [[Shenhe (Genshin impact)|]]'s mentor.

She is playable under her human form, [[Xianyun (Genshin Impact)|]]. Only use this tag when her bird form is in the image.

title: tape_measure
body:
A long and thin strip of plastic or metal, etched with scales. The plastic tape measure is usually short (around 150 cm, although really long ones can reach hundreds of meters) and used by a tailor to take body measurements for clothes-making. The metal ones are usually longer (up to 5 meters and housed in a small dispenser to avoid cutting the hand of its user) and used by carpenters and builders. The dressmaking-related ones are commonly used in the act of [[bust measuring]].

h4. Types

* [[Cased tape measure]]
* [[Open reel tape measure]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tape measure":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tape_measure]

title: open_reel_tape_measure
body:
A very long [[tape measure]] affixed to an exposed spool. Used in construction and sporting events.  Comes in various lengths such as from 100-400 ft (30-120m).

h4. See also

* [[Cased tape measure]]

title: create_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the 34 cards introduced in the anime, capable of bringing creatures or objects into existence. It is captured in episode 31, when Sakura uses the [[Big (clow card)|]] to grow in size to challenge a pink dragon that the Create card made. She wears her [[kinomoto sakura (warrior costume)|Warrior costume]] to capture both cards in this episode.

title: big_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the 34 cards introduced in the anime, capable of growing people and objects in size. Its opposing card is the [[Little (clow card)|]] card. Sakura captures it in episode 31, and is used to make Sakura grow in size to fight a pink dragon that the [[Create (clow card)|]] card made. She wears her [[kinomoto sakura (warrior costume)|Warrior costume]] when capturing both cards.

title: arrow_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the 34 cards introduced in the anime, capable of firing volleys of magical arrows. It is only seen in the first movie's opening story arc, and is used again to free Sakura from drowning in her battle against [[Madoushi]]. Sakura wears her [[kinomoto sakura (green arrow costume)|Green Arrow costume]] while capturing the card.

title: cased_tape_measure
body:
A type of [[tape measure]] featuring a case, typically pocket sized.  Such tape measures retract either using a spring mechanism or hand crack to wind the tape back in.

h4. See also

* [[Open reel tape measure]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tape Measure - Cased measuring tape":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tape_measure#Cased_measuring_tape]

title: glow_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of generating soft glowing lights. It is captured in episode 18, when Sakura attends a summer festival.

title: thunder_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of manipulating electricity. Sakura captures it in episode 8 with help from the [[Shadow (clow card)|]] card. She wears her [[kinomoto sakura (pink kitty costume)|Pink Kitty costume]] while capturing the Thunder card.

title: shadow_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards seen in the manga, capable of controlling the shadows of people and objects. Sakura captures it in episode 2 with help from the [[Windy (clow card)|]] card.

title: bastille_day
body:
The national day of [[France]], celebrated every 14th of July. It commemorates the Storming of the [[Bastille]], which took place on the 14th of July, 1789, during the [[French Revolution]].

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Holidays and Celebrations]]

title: panzer_paladin
body:
Side scroller action [[video game]] developed by Tribute Games and released for [[Nintendo Switch]] and [[computer|PC]] in 2020. 

The game is heavily inspired by early sidescrolling action games and the aesthetic of [[1980s (style)|80s]] [[mecha]] anime, particularly the [[kikou-kai_galient|Panzer World Galient]] [[fantasy]] mecha TV series from 1984 from which it took the colors and look of the protagonist robot, the heroine's [[whip sword]] and the game's name.

h4.See also

* [[Flame (Panzer Paladin)]]
* [[Grit (Panzer Paladin)]]
other_names: パンツァーパラディン

title: shield_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of creating force fields and magical barriers. It is captured in episode 11, as it seals a box that belongs to [[Daidouji Tomoyo]], thinking it is protecting the box for someone important.

title: gold_circlet
body: A [[circlet]] made of [[gold]] or having a golden color.

title: illusion_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of creating optical illusions. It attempts to lure Sakura off a cliff by taking on the visage of her deceased mother [[Kinomoto Nadeshiko]], but [[Tsukishiro Yukito]] saves her and she manages to capture it.

title: maze_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of generating elaborate labyrinths. It is captured in episode 26 by [[Mizuki Kaho]], who then gives it to Sakura.

title: mirror_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of imitating a person's appearance. It is captured in episode 25, after attempting to impersonate Sakura and causing trouble with her visage.

title: lachesis_(kamen_rider_gotchard)
other_names: ラケシス(仮面ライダーガッチャード)

title: erase_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of erasing anything from existence, including people's memories. It is captured in episode 17, after luring Sakura's classmates to the back of a cave and erasing them.

title: jump_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of leaping great distances from one location to another. Sakura captures it in episode 5, first failing to ensnare it with the [[Wood (clow card)|]] card, then forcing it to wear itself out.

title: fly_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of flight itself and granting either inanimate objects or living people the ability to fly. Sakura captures it with the [[Windy (clow card)|]] card, and she frequently uses Fly through the [[Fuuin no Tsue]] to generate wings so she can fly around on the wand.

title: flower_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of growing and controlling flowers. Although benign by nature, Flower has to be captured in episode 10 since she is growing too many flowers at Sakura's school.

title: watery_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of controlling water. Sakura captures it in episode 3 of the anime after she locks it in a walk-in freezer. Sakura wears her [[kinomoto sakura (blue jester costume)|Blue Jester costume]] for this episode.

title: firey_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of controlling fire and regulating temperatures. Sakura captures it in episode 35, and later uses it to capture the [[Snow (clow card)|]] Card.

title: wood_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of growing and manipulating plants. It is one of the few cards to return to the Clow Book willingly, and Sakura uses it to capture the [[Earthy (clow card)|]] Card due to the Chinese balance of elements, where wood is superior to earth.

title: the_pink_panther_(character)
body: Main character from the 1963 cartoon show [[The Pink Panther]]

title: earthy_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of controlling earth. Sakura uses the [[Wood (clow card)|]] to capture Earthy in both the anime and manga.

title: clow_card
body:
Clow Cards are magical [[card|cards]] in [i][[Cardcaptor Sakura]][/i].

Each of them has a "true form", who appears when [[Kinomoto Sakura]] calls the cards to use their magical powers. Most true forms are [[personification|personifications]]; they are girls with colorful themed costumes. Except some, who are [[animalization|animals]] or creatures instead, such as The Fly (a [[bird]]), The Thunder (a giant [[dog]]), etc.

[[everyone|All]] the true forms are seen together in post #1103127.

The Clow Cards were created by the [[Clow Reed]], in their backstory. At some point in the story, the cards change appearance to become pink-ish [[sakura_card|Sakura Cards]].

For the complete list of Clow Cards, see the [[list of Cardcaptor Sakura characters]].

title: windy_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, and the one responsible for scattering the Clow Cards at the beginning of the series, forcing Sakura to recapture them. Windy willingly returns to the Clow Book and helps Sakura in her quest.

title: angewomon
body:
Angewomon is an [[Angel]] [[Digimon]]. It has the appearance of a beautiful woman. Although it was previously classified as an Angel-type, it was confirmed as an Archangel-type because of the greatness of its abilities. 

As their trait, Adult angels have six [[wings]], and Perfect angels have eight [[wings]]. Although its personality is extremely gentle, it cannot forgive those who are crooked or evil, and it won't stay its hand from attacking until the opponent converts. Because of its soul and power, it is said to be a being like a goddess of the Digital World.

title: dark_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of creating a dark void in opposition to the [[Light (clow card)|]] Card's ability to generate light.

title: light_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of controlling light in opposition to the [[Dark (clow card)|]] Card's ability to control darkness.

title: sakawa_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Japanese cruiser [i]Sakawa[/i] in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. 
Voiced by [[Suzuki Aina (voice Actor)|]].

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #5685547.[/tn]

She is portrayed with [[skin-covered horns|skin-covered]] [[red horns]] with a [[gradient horns|gradient]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit is the same as her sister Noshiro's: a [[black serafuku]], [[black skirt]], [[pantyhose]], [[thigh strap]]s, and [[loafers]], but differs in that she also wears a [[black jacket]].

Her rigging is also the same as her sister: a [[katana]], two hull pieces containing her two 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]], one on each side, and two of her 152 mm twin gun mounts, one on each side, plus a third 152 mm twin mount on a separate attachment. The difference is that Sakawa also has an [[oni]] familiar.

h4. History
Due to her being commissioned late in the war and her inability to participate in [[Operation Ten-Gou]], her only claim to fame is being used as a target for [[Operation Crossroads]] at Bikini Atoll in 1946 with several other ships, being sunk in the first [i]Able[/i] detonation.

h4. Skins
* [[sakawa_(the_colors_of_love)_(azur_lane)|The Colors of Love]]

h4. [i]Agano[/i]-class light cruisers
* [[Agano (Azur Lane)|]]
* [[Noshiro (Azur Lane)|]]
* [b]Sakawa[/b]

h4. See also
* [[Sakawa (Kancolle)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Sakawa[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_cruiser_Sakawa]

title: rikka_koukou_marching_band_e_youkoso
body:
The spin-off novel of the [[Hibike! Euphonium]] series titled Hibike! Euphonium Series Rikka Koukou Marching Band e Youkoso.

The story focuses on Rikka High School Marching Band. [[Sasaki Azusa]], Kumiko's friend from middle school, is the main character of this novel.  The story is set in about the same time as the main series but it is told from Rikka High School's perspective instead of Kitauji's.

title: disembodied_head
body:
When a character's head is removed from their neck, but the rest of the body is also present in the image.

Particularly frequent with [[Touhou]]'s [[Sekibanki]] due to her ability to remove her head without dying.

h4. See also

* [[dullahan]]
* [[head only]]
* [[severed head]]

title: head_only
body:
Character's head on its own, without a body. A neck and shoulders count as a body, if they're visible use [[cropped shoulders]] instead.

Can be used when multiple heads or [[chibi]] ([[chibi inset|inset]]) are present.

[b]Do not use[/b] this tag for images where a (headless) body is present or as the  aftermath of decapitation, whether the body actually belongs to the head or not. In such cases, use [[severed head]] instead. 

h1. See also
* [[cropped shoulders]]
* [[disembodied head]]
* [[portrait]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: clockie_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
An NPC from [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A memetic entity created by the Watchmaker who helps the [[Trailblazer_(Honkai:_Star_Rail)|]] during their trip to Penacony. He's considered a mascot on Penacony.

Can be seen as a parody of [[Mickey Mouse]].

title: yagi_toshinori
body: The civillian identity of [[All Might]]. For tagging purposes, the name will be kept to his true, frailer form as well as his younger self rather than tagging both versions as Yagi.

title: nagase_mana
body:
Character in both the [[IDOLY PRIDE]] anime and mobile game. Known as the "Starry Miracle", [[Nagase Mana]] was scouted by Hoshimi Productions four and a half years before the main story began. She invited the player character [[Makino Kouhei]] to join as her manager and rapidly ascended to global stardom, but died tragically in an accident almost two years later. Older sister to [[Nagase Kotono]].

Wears the standard [[Hoshimi Private High School Uniform]].

Voiced by [[Kanda Sayaka]].

title: french_revolution
body:
A period of drastic political and social change, which took place in [[France]] from 1789 to 1799. Its main causes are generally considered to be the financial and economic crises the Kingdom of France had been facing for several years as well as growing discontent among the social classes of France.

h4. See also

* [[Napoleon Bonaparte]]

title: korean_text
body:
The image contains text written in the Korean language.

The most common writing system in Korean today is Hangul, a syllabic alphabet, but in the past [[traditional Chinese text|Chinese characters]] were used to represent words as well (referred to as Hanja), whether exclusively or mixed with Hangul. There are also ways to romanize Korean, generally referred to as [[Romaja text|Romaja]].

h4. See also

* [[Romaja text]]
* [[Tag group:Text]]

title: visual_novel
body:
A style of game that mainly consists of text (both dialogues and narrative) over a background image. Many games have the player make [[choice]]s that affect the outcome of the story.

This tag is for both real and [[fake screenshot]]s of visual novels.

For images featuring only the background image with no [[dialogue box]], use [[game cg]] instead.

h4. See also

title: d_hunter_of_the_dead
body:
[b]D, Hunter of the Dead[/b], is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. His title is in reference to Those Who Live in Death, who he hunts. He wears distinctive and intricate [[full armor|full]] [[plate armor]].

His name is possibly an allusion to [[Vampire Hunter D]].

[spoilers]His true name is Darian and he is one of [[D Beholder Of Death|two]] [[twins|twin]] brothers.

title: jack_frost_(megami_tensei)
body:
[i]"A frost spirit that appears during the winter and melts away in spring. He is made of ice and snow, but do not be fooled by his cute demeanor. Jack Frost freezes people with his cold breath, smiling all the while. He originally looked like an abominable snowman, but he may have changed form, the better to freeze people." [/i]
    —[[Devil Survivor 2]] Compendium 

A recurring demon who serves as the mascot for [[Shin Megami Tensei]] and [[Atlus]]. Characterized by his speech pattern which interjects "hee" and "ho" in his dialogue, hee-ho!

title: homophobia
body: Homophobia encompasses a range of negative attitudes and feelings toward homosexuality or people who identify or are perceived as being lesbian, gay or bisexual. It has been defined as contempt, prejudice, aversion, hatred or antipathy, may be based on irrational fear and may sometimes be related to religious beliefs.

title: rkn-chan
body:
Satirical mascot for "Roskomnadzor":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Service_for_Supervision_of_Communications,_Information_Technology_and_Mass_Media], Russian federal executive body responsible for media and telecommunications.  Main source of Russian Internet censorship (political, pornographic, extremist and pirated content).

The initial design was created by [[flick-the-thief]], the blue pallete is based on the RKN "logo":https://rkn.gov.ru/images/news/image56980.jpg. She was created as ironical backlash in response of the hentai ban in Russia in 2016.

She is totalitarian, but not very smart and naive in terms of how the Internet works. Often displayed with a [[whip]], [[handcuffs]] and surrounded by troopers.

With every unreasonable Roskomnadzor initiative, the popularity of this character grew among Russian artists, which ultimately led to "animation music video":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w9F3U-xbgiU with her. She was covered by the mainstream media and is "popular among":https://daily.afisha.ru/news/9041-devushka-v-obraze-roskomnadzor-tyan-prishla-na-festival-komiksov-v-peterburge/ "Russian cosplayers":https://kanobu.ru/news/kosplej-dnya-roskomnadzor-tyan-blokiruyuschaya-vse-chto-vyilyubite-398076/.

There is a joke of her love to anal plugs because of the accidental blocking of the IP address "127.0.0.1":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Localhost].

Danbooru is blocked (and isn't avalible without VPN) by Roskomnadzor in Russia, since hentai (especially if it features [[loli]]s) was considered child pornography by Russian laws.

Roscomnadzor attempts to block the "Telegram messenger service":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telegram_(software)] in Spring 2018 resulted in "blocking 15.8 million IPs on Amazon and Google's cloud platforms":https://www.theverge.com/2018/4/17/17246150/telegram-russia-ban which led to techinical troubles in various network services for the whole country.

title: imaizumi_kagerou
body:
The "Bamboo Forest's Loup-Garou."  Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [i][[Touhou]][/i] 14, [i][[Double Dealing Character]][/i].

A [[wolf girl|werewolf]] who lives in the Bamboo Forest of the lost. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[red eyes]], with [[wolf ears]] on her head and a [[wolf tail]]. She wears a [[white dress]]* with [[long sleeves]], with a [[red brooch]] adorned on her chest.

*Most artists depict Kagerou's dress as an [[off-shoulder dress]], despite not normally being depicted as such in canon.

h4. External links

* "Touhou wiki":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kagerou_Imaizumi

title: hauling_ship_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]].

Ships capable of transporting a massive quantity of goods. Recommended for industrial or logistical purposes.
Mostly consists of shuttles, [[hauler (EVE Online)|]]s and [[Freighter (EVE Online)|]]s.

title: exploration_ship_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from [[EVE Online]].

Ships made to scout and chart hostile space. Recommended for any reconnaissance operation.

title: tech_3_ship_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft|spaceships]] from the [[EVE Online]].

Tech 3 ships are constructed with Sleeper components that can only be found in Wormhole space. There are two classes of Tech 3 ships currently in the game:
* [[Tactical Destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s are very versatile [[destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s which can switch between different "modes" on the fly. T3 destroyers have generally lower skill requirements than T2 destroyers, as they serve as standard combat ships rather than filling special roles.
* [[Strategic Cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s are the most flexible and among the most powerful ships in the game for their size (and mass), with enormous possible variations in their capabilities, due to their ability to be fitted with one of three subsystems in four different slots. Flying strategic [[cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s requires training in these subsystem’s related skills, and may require a much wider range of other combat skills than [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|]]s.

h5. External links: 
https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Tech_and_meta_levels#Tech_3

title: mazda_furai
body: The Mazda Furai was a concept car revealed on 27 December 2007. It had Mazda's flagship rotary engine design and chassis based on real Le-Mans car. The car wore the number 55, that of its 1991 24 Hours of Le Mans-winning ancestor, the [[Mazda 787B|787B]]. Despite everything looking good up until this point, while the [[Top Gear]] test driver Mark Ticehurst was piloting the Furai on August 19, 2008, it suddenly caught fire, ultimately burning down almost completely, while the pilot escaped fire unscathed. Mazda then abandoned the project, and no news followed.

title: grape_hyacinth
body:
[b][i]Muscari[/i][/b], commonly known as grape hyacinth, is a genus of [[flower]]ing bulbous plants in the family [i]Asparagaceae[/i].

Grape hyacinths are conical or urn-shaped flower clusters that resemble a bunch of grapes, hence the name. The flowers are usually light [[blue flower|blue]] to [[purple flower|purple]], although some species are white, pink or yellow.

Note that this flower is [u]not an actual hyacinth[/u], so it should not be tagged as such.

title: inutade
body:
Inutade is one of [[Shurou]]'s retainers; she's a rare example of an [[oni]] in [[Dungeon Meshi]], a race implied to be pretty much only found in the world's analogue for east Asia. She has [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[black hair]], usually worn in [[twintails]], has [[skin-covered horns]], [[black_eyes|black]], [[sparkling eyes]], and a [[chipped tooth]]. Her [[plump]] torso and [[thick thighs]] belie her tremendous strength, which she uses to wield a [[kanabou]]. She also appears to be about the closest thing to a friend that [[Izutsumi]] had growing up, and the two are seen together in many flashbacks.

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/364279d8-b8ee-4f79-8b62-0f46f96836b5/1]

title: raft
body:
Any flat structure for support or transportation over water; usually a basic design, usually without a hull.
Usually kept afloat by using any combination of buoyant materials such as wood, sealed barrels, or inflated air chambers.
Typically not engine-propelled. 

* !post #7082402
* !post #5339822

Not to be confused with [[swim ring]].

title: pegasus_(constellation)
body:
Pegasus is a [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. It is named after the winged horse [[Pegasus]] in Greek mythology. Its brightest star is Enif.

Pegasus is an easily recognizable constellation. Its four bright stars form a square known as the [i]Great Square of Pegasus[/i], symbolizing the body of the flying horse, usually depicted alongside its head and front legs. The constellation is often depicted together with the constellation of [[Andromeda (constellation)|]] due to the shared star (see post #4712687 upper right for reference).

[[Equules (constellation)|]] (the Foal) is another horse constellation, located right in front of Pegasus's "nose" (Enif).

h5. Example shapes
* !asset #21661326: The Great Square is highlighted
* !asset #21661329: The Great Square is highlighted
* !asset #21661328: Pegasus and Andromeda (one of the combinations)

title: andromeda_(constellation)
body:
Andromeda is a [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. It is named after the chained princess Andromeda in Greek mythology, daughter of [[Cassiopeia (constellation)|]]. Its brightest star is Alpheratz.

Andromeda's brightest star is connected to the constellation of [[Pegasus (constellation)|]], so they are often depicted as a single-like constellation, with Andromeda often resembling the hind legs. What are interpreted as Andromeda's legs point to her husband, [[Perseus (constellation)|]].

title: japan_airlines
body:
The official national airline of [[Japan]]. Established in 1951, their name is often abbreviated as JAL (or [i]jyaru[/i] in Japanese), and are a member of the Oneworld alliance. Their current livery, [i]tsurumaru[/i], features a circular [[crane (animal)|crane]], almost reminiscent of the [[Japanese flag]]

h4. See also

* [[All Nippon Airways]] - Japan Airlines' main competitor

h4. External links:
* "Official website":[https://www.jal.co.jp/ar/en/]
* "Wikipedia page":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Airlines]

title: all_nippon_airways
body:
A major Japanese airline, also referred to as ANA. Established in 1952, they are currently Japan's largest full service airline, surpassing [[japan airlines|JAL]] in both fleet size and number of destinations, and are a member of Star Alliance. Additionally, they were the launch customer of the [[boeing 787|Boeing 787 Dreamliner]] aircraft, which made its first revenue service on 26 October, 2011, and are the largest operator of the type.

h4. See also

* [[Japan Airlines]] - Japanese flag carrier and main rival to ANA
* [[Peach (airline)]] - subsidiary

h4. External links:
* "Official website":[https://www.ana.co.jp/en/jp/]
* "Wikipedia page":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_Nippon_Airways]

title: all_tomorrows
body:
A speculative evolution story by C. M. Koseman. Starting out with the colonization of Mars, the book chronicles the genetic development of humanity until they eventually encounter a far older alien species known as the [[qu_(all_tomorrows)|Qu]], who aggressively transform humanity into a wide variety of new and often bizarre forms.

The story was originally obscure until June 2021, when the YouTube algorithm directed viewers to a video by the channel Alt Shift X summarizing and discussing the story, leading to a surge in popularity and memes.

title: igrene_(fire_emblem)
body:
CV: [[Hara Yumi]] (JP), Krizia Bajos (EN)

Character from [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]]. Igrene is the Guardian of Nabata during the events of the Binding Blade, having succeeded her father [[Hawkeye (Fire Emblem)|Hawkeye]] in that role. Unlike her father, Igrene is a Sniper and fights exclusively with [[bow (weapon)|bows]].

[spoiler]Igrene once married a spy named [[Astolfo (Fire Emblem)|]], who hid away in Nabata under the cover name of Gorlois. During their short-lived marriage, they had a daughter, but she died at a tender age. Gorlois would later run from Nabata, causing Igrene immense heartache.[/spoiler]

Igrene has [[dark skin]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. Her [[red dress|red]] [[short dress|minidress]] reveals her [[cleavage]] and shows off her [[large breasts]]. Her [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]] highlight her [[thighs]] and create [[zettai ryouiki]] together with her dress. Around her waist are [[multiple belts|two belts]]. She also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] and a [[brown cape|brown]] [[cape]].

h4. Designs
* !post #3691169: Default
* !post #4889480: [[igrene (ninja) (fire_emblem)|Ninja Igrene]]
* !post #7112838: [[igrene (sworn protector) (fire emblem)|Sworn Protector Igrene]] (with [[Louise (Fire Emblem)|]])

title: welsh_corgi
body:
A breed of [[dog]] originating from Wales, defined by two types of Corgis: the Cardigan Welsh Corgi, and the Pembroke Welsh Corgi. They generally have long bodies, short stubby legs, and long erect ears.

[[ein (cowboy bebop)|Ein]] from [[Cowboy Bebop]], [[Dousetsu (fate)|]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]], and [[Zwei (rwby)|]] from [[RWBY]] are Pembroke Welsh Corgis.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Dogs]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Welsh_Corgi
other_names: ウェルシュ・コーギー

title: cempoalxochitl
body:
[i]Tagetes erecta[/i], the [[Aztec]] marigold, Mexican marigold, big marigold, cempazúchitl or cempasúchil, is a species of flowering plant in the genus [i]Tagetes[/i] native to [[Mexico]]. Despite being native to the Americas, it is often called the [[Africa]] marigold. In Mexico, this plant is found in the wild in the states of México, Michoacán, [[State of Puebla|Puebla]], and [[State of Veracruz|Veracruz]].

Strongly associated with festivals of the dead since pre-Columbian times, it is used widely in [[Dia de Muertos]] festivals. Whole flowers are often included as part of [[ofrenda]], while carpets of petals are laid to guide souls of the dead to it.

title: rose
body:
A type of [[flower]] associated with romance, and it is a traditional gift given to a loved one. Each color a rose can be in has specific symbolism as well.

[[Red Rose]]s: Red roses are the traditional symbol for love and romance. The red rose has long symbolized beauty and perfection. A bouquet of red roses is the perfect way to express your deep feelings for someone special.

[[Pink Rose]]s: As a symbol of grace and elegance, the pink rose is often given as an expression of admiration. Pink roses can also convey appreciation as well as joyfulness. Pink rose bouquets often impart a gentler meaning than their red counterparts.

[[Yellow Rose]]s: Yellow roses evokes a feeling of warmth and happiness. The warm feelings associated with the yellow rose are often akin to those shared with a true friend.

[[Orange Rose]]s: Orange roses are the embodiment of desire and enthusiasm. Orange roses often symbolize passion and excitement and are an expression of fervent romance. 

[[White Rose]]s: Represents purity and innocence. Can also symbolize honor and reverence. Arrangements of White Roses are used to express remembrance.

[[Purple Rose]]s: With their fantastical appearance, lavender roses are a perfect symbol of enchantment. The lavender rose is also traditionally used to express feelings of love at first sight.

[[Black Rose]]: Black roses do not naturally occur in nature. In fiction, they can represent a tragic romance and symbolizes death, hatred, and farewell. If one is about to embark on a long journey that are unlikely to return from, they might be given a black rose as a farewell.

Other roses not seen in nature but are tagged on Danbooru include [[Blue Rose]]s, [[Brown Rose]]s, [[Golden Rose]]s, [[Green Rose]]s, [[Grey Rose]]s, and [[Multicolored Rose]]s. 

Note that the Pixiv tag "バラ" (read "[[bara]]"), which is literally translated as "rose", is more often used to tag any [[yaoi]] or [[bara]] content, and as such only apply this tag with the actual flower is seen.

h4. See also
* [[Briar (plant)|]]
* [[Carnation]]
* [[Eustoma]]
* [[Ranunculus]]
* [[Rose of Sharon]]
* [[Rose hip]]
* [[Rose petals]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Rose":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rose
* "Wikipedia: Rosaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosaceae

title: zaha
body: Deuteragonist of [[Jinhongi]]. The High Governor of Silla (상선, sangseon) after having formerly been its Governor (국선, gukseon). Was missing for 8 years before the start of the story. He travels with [[Seol Young]] as an authority figure to keep an eye on him.

title: seol_young
body: Protagonist of [[Jinhongi]]. A Hwarang who formerly belonged to the White Tiger Troops at the beginning of the story, who now is unaffiliated. As a result of his association with ghosts as the Ghost Demon King 7 years ago, he is blamed for the return of several powerful spirits in modern day. He travels with [[Zaha]] to defeat ghosts and prove his innocence.

title: barry_allen
body: A [[DC comics]] character, Barry Allen is the fastest man alive, and the second speedster to be called [[the Flash]]. Using his superspeed powers, he taps into the Speed Force and becomes a costumed crime-fighter. He is a founding member of the [[Justice League]].

title: reverse_flash
body:
A legacy of supervillains from [[DC Comics]] serving as the main antagonist of [[The Flash (series)|]] franchise. They are the archenemy of the titular superhero.

The most well-known incarnation, [[Eobard Thawne]] (aka [[Professor Zoom]]) is a scientist from the 25th century who harnesses the power of the negative Speed Force. He was responsible for many tragic events in [[Barry Allen]]'s history, as the Reverse Flash is destined to become his archenemy, despite idolizing him before.
other_names: リバース・フラッシュ

title: goldenglow_(arknights)
body:
[i]Hairdresser and new Caster Goldenglow, tormented by the cycle of shocking and getting shocked.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Susie Glitter

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]159 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An aspiring Victorian hairdresser with electric-based Originium Arts, the sixth child of the large Glitter family.
After the events in Caladon City, she joined Rhodes Island under the recommendation of [[quercus_(arknights)|Quercus]], [[grani_(arknights)|Grani]], and Bitter Root.
She currently works as a beautician at Rhodes Island hair salon. 

At the end of the 1st Anniversary livestream for the CN version of Arknights in mid-2020, a post-credit sequence teased then-upcoming operators [[Thorns (Arknights)|]], [[Surtr (Arknights)|]], [[Saga (Arknights)|]], [[Archetto (Arknights)|]], [[Mountain (Arknights)|]], and Goldenglow. Despite appearing alongside them, by the time of the 2nd anniversary a full year later, she alone remained unreleased, her name still unknown. Speculation ran rampant on why she hadn't appeared yet, even leading to her being misidentified as a Perro rather than a Feline. It wouldn't be until February 8th, 2022 that she would be finally announced properly, class and named included, to appear at the mini event [i]A Light Spark in Darkness[/i].

Despite her ears, her motif is based on [[cat|Cats]], specifically the [[Scottish Fold]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Sakura Ayane]].

h4. Skins

* !post #5670385: Default
* !post #7018212: [[goldenglow (maiden for the bright night) (arknights)|Maiden for the Bright Night]]
* !post #7152576: [[goldenglow (summer flowers) (arknights)|Summer Flowers]]
* !post #7727639: [[goldenglow (party in the garden) (arknights)|Party in the Garden]]

After he formed a business relationship with Rhodes Island, he has provide information about Lungmen subject, as well as recommended talents such as [[Aak (arknights)|]], [[Hung (arknights)|]], and [[Waai Fu (arknights)|]] to Rhodes Island.

One of the main characters of the side story event [i]Invitation to Wine.[/i]

His motif is based on the story about a [[carp]] that transformed into a dragon after jumping over the dragon gate.

His [[voice actor]] is [[miki_shin'ichirou|Miki Shin-ichiro]]

title: tabi
body:
A kind of traditional Japanese [[socks|sock]]. Modern tabi resemble regular socks, only there is a division between the big toe and the other toes, and the soles are usually thicker. Historically, Tabi are commonly made of inelastic materials such as [[leather]] and cotton and have fasteners at the back due to its origin as indoor footwear, but modern Tabi also use stretchable fabrics. For socks with division between all toes use [[toe socks]] instead. 

For tabi that are used as footwear, use [[jika-tabi]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[Japanese clothes]]
* [[jika-tabi]]
* [[socks]]
* [[Miko]]
* [[Ninja]]
* [[Zouri]]
* [[toe socks]]

title: fat_buu
body:
The initial from of [[Majin Buu]] from [[Dragon Ball Z]], also known as "Good Buu" or "Mr. Buu". This form is a result of Buu absorbing the [[Dai Kaioushin]] and the good and evil energy of Earth during the millennia of his sealing, resulting in his schoolyard bully personality and [[fat]] appearance.

After [[Babidi]] revived Buu from his slumber, Buu went on to cause a rampant destruction on earth, mostly to satisfy his hunger by turning any lesser being into [[candy]] and [[chocolate]]. [[Mr. Satan]] later befriended Buu and taught him virtuous values, but soon after he witnessed his [[bee (dragon ball)|adopted stray dog]] being killed by a group of bounty hunters who were sent to kill him, Buu went berserk and killed the bounty hunters in the process. This would result in his [[Evil Buu|evil alter-ego]] being unleashed, who overpowers him and absorbs him back in turn, creating [[Super Buu]].

[spoiler]After [[Super Buu]] was forced to release Fat Buu along with the other victims he absorbed, Fat Buu would become a separate entity, while Super Buu would transform into Buu's pure evil form, known as [[Kid Buu]].[/spoiler]

title: deaf
body:
Deafness is a condition that describes the loss of hearing in a person or [[animal]] . Deafness can be partial or total, meaning a person may be able to hear some amount of sound, or none at all. Deafness can be present at birth, which is known as congenital deafness, if it develops before a child has learned to speak it's known as "prelingual deafness":[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prelingual_deafness]. Deafness can also develop later in life.

Tag what you see, not what you know, so this tag is not used to simply tag images of characters who are canonically deaf. Use this tag if the image directly relates to deafness. This tag is used for images wherein it's shown that the subject is deaf.

Types of images where [I]Deaf[/i] may be an applicable tag:

* Images wherein the character declares themselves or another to be deaf. 

* Showcases of situations wherein a characters deafness may cause awkwardness or some sort of unusual situation.

* Images where characters use [[sign language]] or non-verbal communication because of their or anothers deafness. 

* Posts wherein a person is using some kind of [[hearing aid]]

title: hearing_aid
body:
The [i]National Institute on Deafness and Other Communicative Disorders[/i] describes a hearing aid as; "a small electronic device that you wear in or behind your ear. It makes some sounds louder so that a person with hearing loss can listen, communicate, and participate more fully in daily activities. A hearing aid can help people hear more in both quiet and noisy situations." "Source":[https://www.nidcd.nih.gov/health/hearing-aids]

In anime and manga characters with [[deaf|deafness]] are quite rare, but ones that do have the disability may be presented with hearing aids in their ears and/or using [[sign language]]. 

H5. Characters with hearing aids
* [[Nishimiya Shouko]]
* [[Itose Yuki]]

title: demonic_creature
